com.sap.cloud.sdk.s4hana.generator

Class DataModelGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sap.cloud.sdk.s4hana.generator.DataModelGenerator

  • public class DataModelGenerator
extends Object
    Wrapper for the ODataToVdmGenerator, gathering all relevant parameter or providing default values for unspecified ones.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String DEFAULT_BASE_PACKAGE_NAME
      The default package prefix of the generated sources.
      static boolean DEFAULT_DELETE_TARGET_DIR
      The default flag indicating whether the target directory should be deleted prior to the generation.
      static boolean DEFAULT_FORCE_FILE_OVERRIDE
      The default flag indicating whether already existing files should be overridden or an exception is thrown.
      static String DEFAULT_INPUT_DIRECTORY
      The default directory to search and save configuration data in.
      static String DEFAULT_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY
      The default directory to store the generated sources in.
      static String DEFAULT_SERVICE_NAME_MAPPING_FILE
      The default file path to the name mapping properties file.

      The directory to search the service data in.

      The root directory to store the generated sources in.

      Specifies the package prefix to be used in the generated sources.

public DataModelGenerator withInputDirectory(@NonNull

      • withOutputDirectory

        @NonNull
public DataModelGenerator withOutputDirectory(@NonNull
                                                       String outputDirectory)
        The root directory to store the generated sources in.

        The generated sources will be stored under this directory according to the packages specified.

        Parameters:
        outputDirectory - The root directory to store the generated sources in.
        Returns:
        This DataModelGenerator for chained method calls.

      • withServiceNameMapping

        @NonNull
public DataModelGenerator withServiceNameMapping(@NonNull
                                                          String serviceNameMappingFile)
        The path to the properties file containing the service name mapping.

        Any service not mapped in this file will get created/updated.

        Parameters:
        serviceNameMappingFile - The file to read/set the service name mappings in.
        Returns:
        This DataModelGenerator for chained method calls.

        Returns:
        This DataModelGenerator for chained method calls.

      • deleteTargetDirectory

        @NonNull
public DataModelGenerator deleteTargetDirectory()
        Deletes the target directory specified by withPackageName(String) prior to generating the sources.

        This option should be used to determine the whole change set, including deleted files.

        Returns:
        This DataModelGenerator for chained method calls.

      • forceFileOverride

        @NonNull
public DataModelGenerator forceFileOverride()
        With this option, already existing files will get overridden. The default behaviour is throwing an exception.
        Returns:
        This DataModelGenerator for chained method calls.

      • execute

        public void execute()
             throws org.apache.olingo.odata2.api.ep.EntityProviderException,
                    IOException,
                    org.apache.olingo.odata2.api.edm.EdmException,
                    org.apache.commons.configuration.ConfigurationException,
                    com.sun.codemodel.JClassAlreadyExistsException
        Executes the actual generator based on the given parameter or, in case of absence, their default values.
        Throws:
        org.apache.olingo.odata2.api.ep.EntityProviderException - If an error occurred during the creation of the files.
        IOException - If any files could not be read, written, or deleted.
        org.apache.olingo.odata2.api.edm.EdmException - If an error occurred during the creation of the files.
        org.apache.commons.configuration.ConfigurationException - If the name mappings file could not be read/written.
        com.sun.codemodel.JClassAlreadyExistsException - If a generated class already exists.
